facts.fact_name: Testosterone levels among sex offenders and the general population are not meaningfully different
facts.reference: Wong, J. S., & Gravel, J. (2018). Do sex offenders have higher levels of testosterone? Results from a meta-analysis. Sexual Abuse, 30(2), 147-168.

facts.fact_name: Testosterone levels have positive, but small, relationships with pair bonding (.15), mate acquisition behavior (.21) and fatherhood (.19)
facts.reference: Grebe, N. M., Sarafin, R. E., Strenth, C. R., & Zilioli, S. (2019). Pair-bonding, fatherhood, and the role of testosterone: A meta-analytic review. Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews, 98, 221-233.

facts.fact_name: Testosterone administration does not negatively affect cooperative behaviors
facts.reference: Yang, X., Wang, W., Wang, X. T., & Wang, Y. W. (2021). A meta-analysis of hormone administration effects on cooperative behaviours: Oxytocin, vasopressin, and testosterone. Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews, 126, 430-443.

facts.fact_name: Soy does not feminize you nor decrease total testosterone (TT), free testosterone (FT), estradiol (E2), estrone (E1), or sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG)
facts.reference: Reed, K. E., Camargo, J., Hamilton-Reeves, J., Kurzer, M., & Messina, M. (2021). Neither soy nor isoflavone intake affects male reproductive hormones: An expanded and updated meta-analysis of clinical studies. Reproductive Toxicology, 100, 60-67.

facts.fact_name: Testosterone and cortisol do not have any meaningful association with status, dominance, risk-taking, aggression, nor psychopathy
facts.reference: Dekkers, T. J., van Rentergem, J. A. A., Meijer, B., Popma, A., Wagemaker, E., & Huizenga, H. M. (2019). A meta-analytical evaluation of the dual-hormone hypothesis: Does cortisol moderate the relationship between testosterone and status, dominance, risk taking, aggression, and psychopathy?. Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews, 96, 250-271

facts.fact_name: Testosterone and cortisol do not have any meaningful association with personality: openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, and neuroticism
facts.reference: Sundin, Z. W., Chopik, W. J., Welker, K. M., Ascigil, E., Brandes, C. M., Chin, K., … & Tackett, J. L. (2021). Estimating the associations between big five personality traits, testosterone, and cortisol. Adaptive Human Behavior and Physiology, 7(3), 307-340.

facts.fact_name: Anabolic-androgenic steroid (AAS) use administration was associated with only a small increase in self-reported aggression and no increase in observer-reported aggression
facts.reference: Chegeni, R., Pallesen, S., McVeigh, J., & Sagoe, D. (2021). Anabolic-androgenic steroid administration increases self-reported aggression in healthy males: a systematic review and meta-analysis of experimental studies. Psychopharmacology, 238(7), 1911-1922.
table: Self-reported (random-effects) AAS administered over longer periods
Self-reported (fixed-effects) AAS administered in high dose (over 500 mg)

facts.fact_name: Testosterone has no relationship with mating success, measured by sexual partners within the last twelve months, lifetime sexual partners and lifetime number of one-night stands.
facts.reference: Kordsmeyer, T. L., Hunt, J., Puts, D. A., Ostner, J., & Penke, L. (2018). The relative importance of intra-and intersexual selection on human male sexually dimorphic traits. Evolution and Human Behavior, 39(4), 424-436.

facts.fact_name: Testosterone and cortisol do not affect facial attractiveness, facial dominance, facial health
facts.reference: Kordsmeyer, T. L., Lohöfener, M., & Penke, L. (2019). Male facial attractiveness, dominance, and health and the interaction between cortisol and testosterone. Adaptive Human Behavior and Physiology, 5(1), 1-12.

facts.fact_name: High intensity exercise produces acute increases in testosterone, but returns to baseline one hour following activity
facts.reference: D’andrea, S., Spaggiari, G., Barbonetti, A., & Santi, D. (2020). Endogenous transient doping: physical exercise acutely increases testosterone levels—results from a meta-analysis. Journal of endocrinological investigation, 43(10), 1349-1371.

facts.fact_name: Church attendance is associated with higher educational attainment among Christians
facts.reference: https://religionunplugged.com/news/2023/9/12/education-lets-have-a-talk-about-religious-attendance

facts.fact_name: Eating locally does not meaningfully reduce your carbon footprint
facts.reference: https://ourworldindata.org/food-choice-vs-eating-local

facts.fact_name: Eating organic food requires more land, cause more eutrophication (harmful algal blooms), have more acidification potential, and emit the same amount of greenhouse gas emissions as conventional systems (but use a smaller, similar amount energy)
facts.reference: Clark, M., & Tilman, D. (2017). Comparative analysis of environmental impacts of agricultural production systems, agricultural input efficiency, and food choice. Environmental Research Letters, 12, 064016.

facts.fact_name: Grass-fed beef produces more greenhouse gas emissions, uses more land, and causes more eutrophication than grain-fed beef
facts.reference: Clark, M., & Tilman, D. (2017). Comparative analysis of environmental impacts of agricultural production systems, agricultural input efficiency, and food choice. Environmental Research Letters, 12, 064016.

facts.fact_name: The most impactful ways to reduce your carbon footprint are: having one fewer child, living car-free (or adjacent behavior), avoiding airplane travel, and eating a plant-based diet
facts.reference: Seth Wynes and Kimberly A Nicholas (2017) The climate mitigation gap: education and government recommendations miss the most effective individual actions. Environ. Res. Lett. 12 074024

facts.fact_name: The simple grocery bag is the most environmentally friendly bag option for the environment, especially compared to paper bags: Organic cotton bags have to be used at least 149 times to oset their climate impact; this is compared to 43 times for regular paper bags and once for low-density polyethylene (LDPE) plastic bags
facts.reference: Bisinella et. al., (2018). Life Cycle Assessment of grocery carrier bags

facts.fact_name: The simple grocery bag is the most environmentally friendly bag option for the environment, especially compared to paper bags: Any decision to ban traditional polyethylene plastic grocery bags in favor of bags made from alternative materials (compostable plastic or recycled paper) will be counterproductive and result in a significant increase in environmental impacts across a number of categories from global warming effects to the use of precious potable water resources.
facts.reference: Boustead Consulting & Associates. (2018). Life Cycle Assessment for Three Types of Grocery Bags. Progressive Bag Alliance.

facts.fact_name: Doubling the population density increases CO2 efficiency typically by 42%
facts.reference: Ramana Gudipudi, Till Fluschnik, Anselmo García Cantú Ros, Carsten Walther, Jürgen P. Kropp, City density and CO2 efficiency, Energy Policy, Volume 91

facts.fact_name: Nuclear and Solar power are the safest and cleanest energy sources per watt of electricity generated
facts.reference: Hannah Ritchie (2020) - “What are the safest and cleanest sources of energy?” Published online at OurWorldInData.org. Retrieved from: 'https://ourworldindata.org/safest-sources-of-energy' [Online Resource]

facts.fact_name: University graduates are two to five times as likely to hold a degree in the field that their parents graduated from
facts.reference: Altmejd, Adam, Inheritance of Fields of Study (2024). CESifo Working Paper No. 11113, Available at SSRN: https://ssrn.com/abstract=4827105 or http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.4827105

facts.fact_name: Increased education has no effect long-term on brain-strucutre
facts.reference: Judd and Kievit (2024). No effect of additional education on long-term brain structure: a preregistered natural experiment in over 30,000 individuals. bioRxiv 2024.05.17.594682

facts.fact_name: Low IQ scores from developing countries are likely accurate and not due to test bias
facts.reference: Rindermann (2024). Surprisingly low results from studies on cognitive ability in developing countries: are the results credible?. Discov Educ 3, 55 (2024). https://doi.org/10.1007/s44217-024-00135-5

facts.fact_name: The threshold hypothesis, that there are diminishing returns to intelligence, is not supported by the data: A longitudinal analysis of teenagers (SMPY) showed ability differences within the top 1% made a difference in obtaining a doctorate degree
facts.reference: Wai, J. (2014). Experts are born, then made: Combining prospective and retrospective longitudinal data shows that cognitive ability matters. Intelligence, 45, 74-80

facts.fact_name: The threshold hypothesis, that there are diminishing returns to intelligence, is not supported by the data: A longitudinal analysis of 12 year olds (SMPY, TIP) who had IQ of 160+ (n=259), by age 40, 37% had a doctorate degree, 15% held one or more patents, and a virtually all were business executives, authors, entrepreneurs, and other high-achieving professionals
facts.reference: Makel, Matthew & Kell, Harrison & Lubinski, David & Putallaz, Martha & Benbow, Camilla. (2016). When Lightning Strikes Twice: Profoundly Gifted, Profoundly Accomplished. Psychological Science. 27. 10.1177/0956797616644735

facts.fact_name: The threshold hypothesis, that there are diminishing returns to intelligence, is not supported by the data: Test scores do not lose predictive power with increases in ability level or at a certain threshold.
facts.reference: Coyle (2015). Relations among general intelligence (g), aptitude tests, and GPA: Linear effects dominate. Intelligence. 53. 16-22. 10.1016/j.intell.2015.08.005

facts.fact_name: The threshold hypothesis, that there are diminishing returns to intelligence, is not supported by the data: There is no support for any downside to higher ability and no evidence for a threshold beyond which greater scores cease to be beneficial
facts.reference: Brown, Matt & Wai, Jonathan & Chabris, Christopher. (2021). Can You Ever Be Too Smart for Your Own Good? Comparing Linear and Nonlinear Effects of Cognitive Ability on Life Outcomes. Perspectives on Psychological Science. 16. 174569162096412. 10.1177/1745691620964122.

facts.fact_name: Creative individuals are more likely to score higher on intelligence tests (r = .25 - .37)
facts.reference: Gerwig, Anne & Miroshnik, Kirill & Forthmann, Boris & Benedek, Mathias & Karwowski, Maciej & Holling, Heinz. (2021). The Relationship between Intelligence and Divergent Thinking – A Meta-Analytic Update. Journal of Intelligence.

facts.fact_name: High IQ individuals are not more likely to be mentally ill: Each standard deviation decrease in IQ results in a 12% increase in the risk of psychiatric contact
facts.reference: Walker, Nicholas & Mcconville, Pauline & Hunter, David & Deary, Ian & Whalley, Lawrence. (2002). Childhood mental ability and lifetime psychiatric contact: A 66-year follow-up study of the 1932 Scottish Mental Ability Survey. Intelligence. 30. 233-245.

facts.fact_name: High IQ individuals are not more likely to be mentally ill: There is a significant negative genetic correlations between intelligence alone and schizophrenia, neuroticism, depression, ADHD
facts.reference: Hill, W.D., Marioni, R.E., Maghzian, O. et al. A combined analysis of genetically correlated traits identifies 187 loci and a role for neurogenesis and myelination in intelligence. Mol Psychiatry 24, 169–181 (2019)

facts.fact_name: High IQ individuals are not more likely to be mentally ill: Highly intelligent individuals (130+ IQ) in the UK Biobank were less likely to be nuerotic, socially isolated, and suffer from general anxiety and PTSD, and no more likely to have depression, social anxiety, a drug use disorder, eating disorders, OCD, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia.
facts.reference: Williams, Camille & Peyre, Hugo & Labouret, Ghislaine & Fassaya, Judicaël & García, Adoración & Gauvrit, Nicolas & Ramus, Franck. (2022). High Intelligence is not a Risk Factor for Mental Health Disorders.

facts.fact_name: High IQ individuals are not more likely to be mentally ill: Highly gifted students with IQs of 130 and 144 did not have more social or emotional problems than children with IQs in the 110s and 120s
facts.reference: Guldemond, Henk & Bosker, Roel & Kuyper, Hans & Werf, Margaretha. (2007). Do Highly Gifted Students Really Have Problems?. Educational Research and Evaluation. 13. 555-568.

facts.fact_name: Low intelligence is not wholly due to low socioeconomic status: Meta-analytically, intelligence is not a better predictor than parental SES or grades
facts.reference: Strenze, Tarmo. (2007). Intelligence and Socioeconomic Success: A Meta-Analytic Review of Longitudinal Research. Intelligence. 35. 401-426
